page.title: 14HOUSING IN CHELMSFORD
page.content: The central area of Chelmsford contains a nucleus of Victorian, Edwardian and inter-war period terraced and detached housing.During the 1960's and 1970's,large estate developments were built around the Springfield,Melborne,Baddow,Moulsham and Westlands areas. These,together with the 1980's developments of Newland's Spring,North Springfield and Chelmer Village, provide a range of housing attractive to both the locally-employed and the London commuter. {Average prices taken from 300 houses {on sale in June 1985,in Chelmsford:- Terraced houses(old).Â£25,000-Â£35,000 Terraced houses(new).Â£33,000-Â£39,000 Semi-detached(modern)Â£40,000-Â£51,000 Detached houses(modern,4 bedroom size) ....Â£50,000-Â£67,000
